meanings.sent1: The car's rev was so high that it zoomed past us.
meanings.sent2: The sudden rev in the factory's production surprised everyone.
meanings.sent3: The rev in the playground was so fast that the children couldn't keep up.
meanings.sent4: Her energy level had a rev like a rocket taking off.
meanings.sent5: The rev of the music made everyone start dancing.

meanings.definition: One complete turn of a machine or engine
meanings.sent1: With one rev of the engine, the car started moving.
meanings.sent2: The motorcycle's rev indicated it was ready to go.
meanings.sent3: The rev of the blender mixed the ingredients perfectly.
meanings.sent4: The rev of the drill echoed through the workshop.
meanings.sent5: The rev of the fan kept the room cool.

meanings.definition: To increase the speed or activity of something
meanings.sent1: He had to rev up the engine to climb the steep hill.
meanings.sent2: The coach told the team to rev their efforts for the final game.
meanings.sent3: She decided to rev up her study routine before the exam.
meanings.sent4: The company needed to rev its marketing strategies to attract more customers.
meanings.sent5: The teacher tried to rev up the class by introducing a fun activity.
